Glycolysis in the cytoplasm, the Krebs cycle in the mitochondria, and oxidative phosphorylation in the mitochondria

answers: Supervised learning is when the machine is given labelled data to learn from, while unsupervised learning is when the machine is not given any labels

Medium.text: What is the difference between classification and regression in machine learning?
answers: Classification is the process of predicting a categorical label, while regression is the process of predicting a continuous value
Classification is the process of predicting a continuous value, while regression is the process of predicting a categorical label
Classification and regression are the same process, but with different names
Classification is the process of identifying patterns in data, while regression is the process of transforming data into a more usable format

Medium.text: What is the difference between overfitting and underfitting in machine learning?
answers: Overfitting occurs when a model is too complex and learns the noise in the training data, while underfitting occurs when a model is too simple and does not capture the underlying patterns in the data
Overfitting occurs when a model is too simple and does not capture the underlying patterns in the data, while underfitting occurs when a model is too complex and learns the noise in the training data
Overfitting and underfitting are the same thing, but with different names
Overfitting occurs when a model is too complex and captures the underlying patterns in the data, while underfitting occurs when a model is too simple and captures only the noise in the data

Medium.text: What is the difference between a generative model and a discriminative model in machine learning?
answers: A generative model generates new data, while a discriminative model discriminates between different classes of data
A generative model discriminates between different classes of data, while a discriminative model generates new data
A generative model and a discriminative model are the same thing, but with different names
A generative model generates new data based on the underlying distribution of the data, while a discriminative model learns the boundary between different classes of data

Medium.text: What is the purpose of a convolutional neural network (CNN) in computer vision?
answers: To learn features of images by convolving filters over the image and down-sampling the result
To classify images by comparing them to a database of pre-existing images
To generate new images by sampling from a learned distribution
To segment images into regions with different semantic meanings

Medium.text: What is the difference between a decision tree and a random forest in machine learning?
answers: A decision tree is a single tree-like model, while a random forest is an ensemble of many decision trees

A decision tree and a random forest are the same thing, but with different names
A decision tree and a random forest are both single tree-like models, but the random forest is trained using random subsets of the data

Hard.text: What is the difference between a Boltzmann machine and a Hopfield network in neural networks?
answers: Boltzmann machines are unsupervised learning models, while Hopfield networks are supervised learning models
Boltzmann machines are feedforward neural networks, while Hopfield networks are recurrent neural networks
Boltzmann machines are used for regression problems, while Hopfield networks are used for classification problems
Boltzmann machines and Hopfield networks are the same thing, but with different names

Hard.text: What is the difference between a Markov decision process (MDP) and a Partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP) in reinforcement learning?
answers: MDPs assume that the current state of the environment is fully observable, while POMDPs assume that the current state is partially observable
MDPs are used for continuous action spaces, while POMDPs are used for discrete action spaces
MDPs use model-based methods, while POMDPs use model-free methods
MDPs and POMDPs are the same thing, but with different names

Hard.text: What is the difference between a convolutional neural network (CNN) and a recurrent neural network (RNN) in deep learning?
answers: CNNs are used for image and video processing, while RNNs are used for natural language processing
CNNs use convolutional layers for feature extraction, while RNNs use recurrent layers for temporal processing
CNNs are supervised learning models, while RNNs are unsupervised learning models
CNNs and RNNs are the same thing, but with different names

Hard.text: What is the difference between a support vector machine (SVM) and a decision tree in machine learning?
answers: SVMs are used for regression problems, while decision trees are used for classification problems
SVMs use decision boundaries to separate different classes, while decision trees use a hierarchical tree structure to make decisions
SVMs are unsupervised learning models, while decision trees are supervised learning models
SVMs and decision trees are the same thing, but with different names

Hard.text: What is the difference between a long-term and short-term memory in neural networks?
answers: Long-term memory is used for storing data over an extended period of time, while shortterm memory is used for storing data for a short period of time
Long-term memory is used for unsupervised learning, while short-term memory is used for supervised learning
Long-term memory refers to the structure of a neural network, while short-term memory refers to the activation of neurons
Long-term memory and short-term memory are the same thing, but with different names
